definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: I play four instruments, all self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 我會四種樂器，都是無師自通。

sentences.english: I've taught myself how to ride a camel.
sentences.chinese: 我無師自通，學會騎駱駝了。

sentences.english: Even without a teacher, the village people would ask him to run for paper-cut wedding.
sentences.chinese: 無師自通之後，村裏人辦喜事都會請他出馬剪紙。

sentences.english: She learned Latin without a master.
sentences.chinese: 她無師自通學會了拉丁語。

definition: not one good point/everything about it is wrong
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
